text:
I ran into a small compatibility problem.  The MoveMethod was taking a move
destination path like "/a/b/c.txt", and converting it to
"scheme://server:port/a/b/c.txt".

Unfortunately, it would do so even if the default port was in use, so instead of:

http://server/a/b/c.txt

you'd get

http://server:80/a/b/c.txt

This caused problems for my application (not using Slide as the back-end). 
While I fixed my application, it also seemed like a good idea to fix this in the
webdavclientlib for interoperability reasons.

While I was there, I noticed that both MoveMethod and CopyMethod assume that the
destination is an absolute path on the same server, when it could possibly be a
full URL either to the same server or another server.  I concluded that a URL to
a different server must be allowed based on section 8.8.5 and 8.9.4, which list
status code 502 as a valid return.

A small patch for both issues to follow shortly.
